title: Using MySQL Workbench
learning_objectives: Understand the Using MySQL Workbench concept in SQL

definition.concept_explanation: 42 Section 1 Arz introduction to MySQL An introduction to MySQL Workbench MySQL Workbench is a free graphical tool that makes it easy to work with MySQL.

examples.title: SQL Example 1
examples.expected_output:
| id | name | email | age | city |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Alice | alice@email.com | 25 | Seattle |
| 2 | Bob | bob@email.com | 30 | Portland |
| 3 | Charlie | charlie@email.com | 22 | Seattle |

common_mistakes.title: Syntax error
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Typo in SQL keyword. The correct keyword is FROM, not FORM.

common_mistakes.title: Missing semicolon
common_mistakes.error_message: Some databases require semicolons to end statements
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: While some SQL implementations are lenient, it's best practice to end statements with semicolons.
common_mistakes.key_takeaway: Always end SQL statements with a semicolon

practice_challenge.description: Practice using mysql-workbench with the practice schemas.
practice_challenge.hint: Review the examples above and try writing your own query.
practice_challenge.explanation: This is a basic query to get you started. See the linked practice problems for more challenges.
